answers.answer: i had gd too.  w/ my first dd who is now 17 i didnt have it.  my 2nd ended in m/c, too.  my third i had gd but i went on to deliver a healthy happy baby!!  dont worry.  i think that number sounds where i was at and i was able to control it w/ diet.  you have to watch portion size and carbs.  no sugar or even fruit.  well limited fruit and types.  all will be ok. sorry i cant help w/ anemia but i think you will need an iron supplement??

question: I will be 31 weeks on Thurs, 7/19.  Ok, so I had the GD test done on July 5th, had regular appt last night, 7/16, assuming all is well I ask about the results from the glucose test since I didn't hear anything and the dr tells me its abnormal.  My score was a 200, also informs me I'm anemic.   So I have the 3 hour test on Friday, what should I expect from that?  I can't believe I have come so far to start having issues now.  This is 3rd pregnancy, 1st one no problems and had a healthy dd, 2nd one ended with a blighted ovum at 11 weeks, and I thought I was getting through this one with no problems, sorry for the long post not really questions just venting and scared.  Thanks to all who reply and sticky baby dust to all.
title: Gestational Diabetes and Anemia
